{"step_by_step_thinking": "Inversion of the foot refers to the movement of the sole of the foot towards the midline of the body. The muscles responsible for this movement are the tibialis anterior, tibialis posterior, and extensor hallucis longus. The peroneus longus muscle, on the other hand, is responsible for eversion of the foot, which is the movement of the sole of the foot away from the midline of the body. Therefore, the muscle that does NOT work for inversion of the foot is the Peroneus longus.", "answer_choice": "D"}
